title: Leah Bracknell's explosive Emmerdale exit went down in history after 16 years on soap

Late Leah Bracknell made soap history with her explosive Emmerdale exit.

The actress, who died age 55 after a battle with lung cancer, walked in the stilettos of Zoe Tate on Emmerdale for 16 years.

Her acting was pioneering as she played the first lesbian character on a British soap.

So it's no wonder Leah scooped the Best Exit at the British Soap Awards when she made a dramatic exit from the show.

Her character left the village after blowing up Home Farm where the family had lived behind her in one of the most memorable Emmerdale soap exits ever.

The soap star left the series in 2005 and she was bestowed with the award in 2006.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Her character was always the centre of drama as she played the part sensitively with storylines concerning sexuality and mental health.

There were a string of awards to her name over the years while she played Zoe.

These included Most Popular Actress at the National Television Awards and Best Dramatic Performance at the British Soap Awards.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

It was confirmed the Emmerdale actress had died aged 55.

In a statement they said: "It is with the deepest sadness that Leah Bracknell's family confirm that Leah passed away in September, three years after her diagnosis with stage 4 lung cancer.

"They would like to thank all the public for their support and generosity which contributed to the extension and quality of her life over the past three years.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

"Leah continued to embrace life and faced her illness with positivity. Many aspects of her journey can be found on her blog.

"Leah was best known and much loved as Zoe Tate in Emmerdale.

"She also had roles in Judge John Deed, A Touch of Frost, The Royal Today and DCI Banks to name just a few, as well as numerous appearances on stage and in pantomime.

"As well as acting, Leah was also an accomplished yoga teacher and shamanic healer.

"Leah had an energy and enthusiasm for life, a kind heart and much love to give to those around her.

"Her family have asked for privacy at this very sad time."
